intro: [WRONG START] Pawi octandra, commonly known as the African cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into pods containing edible seeds. It is often cultivated for its nutritious seeds, which are rich in protein and used in various traditional dishes. The plant also plays a role in soil enrichment due to its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen.
